New Records: Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra combined for a record 273 for the second wicket, one run shy of the record for any wicket.
Key Match Events: Devon Conway (152no from 121) and Rachin Ravindra (123no from 96) both smashed unbeaten centuries.
New Zealand's Matt Henry (3-48), Mitchell Santner (2-37), and Trent Boult (1-48) each responded for the stand-in skipper.
Joe Root (77) and Jos Buttler (43) then accumulated well in the middle overs before Matt Henry returned to nick out the latter.
Pre-Game Insights: England had earned a convincing 3-1 series win over the Black Caps last month, and they headed to India among the favourites.
Post-Match Reflections: The Black Caps played like they had been waiting four long years for a chance to banish the heartbreak of Lordâ€™s.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand next play three games they will expect to win before encountering the hosts and the stretch of schedule that will determine their semifinal fate.
The missing pacemen left Tom Latham needing to carefully manage his bowling group after winning the toss.
Others: The Wellington pair were making their ODI World Cup bows, domestic teammates when the Black Caps were denied a maiden crown by a boundary countdown after the tied 2019 final.
